title: Earn Back Your Perma Banned Acount
body: Hi Everyone, i just had a thought and i know alot of players out there might agree with me. With league sometimes things happen, we are all human and sometimes weither it be toxic behaviour or using cheats we all make mistakes, its in our nature. I really think Riot should Create a Earn back your account system Where you have to play like 1000 games or something without getting one report, in order to get back a perma banned account. What do you guys think? Isnt the point of making a mistake to learn from it and then be given a second Chance?{{champion:99}}

replies.body:
1) Look up the word "permanent".

2) Chat restrictions & 14 days suspension are considered 2nd chances.

They already tried it.  Back around S1 or S2, Riot attempted the Level 20 Challenge.  They handpicked a set of permabanned players they thought *most likely* to succeed, and the results were so dismal, they pulled the plug almost before word hit the forums and they've never attempted a similar program since.

The thing is, permanent bans aren't the first line of defense, it's a last resort.

Why didn't players learn from prior punishments?

because nobody got perma banned back in the day, it was unheard of. so even with chat restriction after chat restriction and 14 day bans people figure as long as they aren't toxic enough to (their own standards) then they will never get perma banned just continue getting lesser punishments

> because nobody got perma banned back in the day, it was unheard of. so even with chat restriction after chat restriction and 14 day bans people figure as long as they aren't toxic enough to (their own standards) then they will never get perma banned just continue getting lesser punishments

But Riot has been permabanning for years and they explicitly explained that there is a punishment escalation system. Unless they just flat out ignored Riot and didn't believe that Riot would hand out permanent bans when they said they would...? Isn't that the player's fault for not believing Riot?

so if you don't believe in god when god says to pray for redemption and you go to hell for it isn't that the persons fault for not believing in god? I'm not actually about to argue this specific point with you. 

riot has been permabanning for years I agree. so I would draw a line accounts have to be before riot implemented the current system of 10 - 25 chat ban 14- perma ban
Where would you draw the line? let me ask you this. the first ever account that riot has perma banned, should that player be allowed a CHANCE. to prove their reform and once proven if they are toxic in just ONE game get perma banned? If you say no then there is simply no further discussion or progress to be made between you and I

If you say no then there is simply no further discussion or progress to be made between you and I

No one on the forums I have seen was banned after one bad game. Everyone on the forums has said they have had multiple prior punishments, or Tantram has come down and corrected them and disclosing the number of prior punishments.

No one should ever be permabanned for one toxic game unless it was the most extreme of extreme cases. 

I'm not sure where you're getting your examples from but LOTS of people on the forum lie about their punishment history and claim they're getting unreasonably punished by either editing their chat log or lying about their punishment history. They think that getting the forum's sympathy means they'll get their punishment reversed, but we don't have that power. Player support does, and they can see full chat logs, full punishment histories, and what not. We, the forum, only see what players post and what Tantram posts to correct lies that players have made.

Riot already tried it and based on their numbers, 95% of permabanned toxic players that contacted player support and agreed to 1 on 1 counseling on player behavior with support specialists didn't reform. So, that's just the people who contacted player support and said they wanted to reform. The number is going to be even worse for players who didn't even care to try and just created a new account to be toxic to everyone out of spite.

I don't see how giving them another chance will actually help.

I already commented about that below to AJStarhiker, those people probably had maximum 5 months to reform on a game where they probably didn't care about their rank or rank rewards and the lvl 1-30 grind was the same as them playing normals at level 30 It's as if you got banned on fortnite why reform when you can just make a new acc without losing anything? I doubt a lot of people had spent $500 dollars on their account by that point

No we don't need those toxic players in the League community, I don't know how hard it is to literally type in /muteall in chat. You won't see their text, and best of all you probably won't text. So it's basically a win/win for both players.

I think this system would be okay if someone was racist, said death threats, was inting etc.
Those are one-time things that immediately result in a permaban. Mistakes happen, and those are big ones, but it only happened once. For 99% of league players, the phrase “Kys” doesn’t have real meaning behind it. I’m not saying that it should be allowed in any way, but if someone showed they were done with using “kys” as an empty threat I would be fine with a second chance.

However if this person was toxic 4 times and got 4 intermediate punishments, chances are they aren’t reforming. And they’ll probably just make another account and use it anyway.
The chat restrictions and the 14 day bans are the warnings and the second chances, good riddance to them.

Person ally i wouldn't mind them getting their main  accounts back after a lonnnngggg period of proof of reform. 

If course this will happen after all the other better behavior initiatives have been implemented.
